intro: Phacelia divaricata f. wrangeliana, commonly known as Wrangel's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in alpine or subalpine environments. Its small, tubular flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
